French left seeks to latch on to success of petition against pesticides
description: Energized by the success of a grassroots petition calling for the repeal of a law reauthorizing a banned pesticide, left-wing parties have pledged to keep up the pressure on the government.

French nuclear energy splits Germany's ruling coalition
description: France has counted on a shift in Germany's nuclear policy ever since the arrival of conservative Friedrich Merz – whose party supports nuclear energy, unlike the Social Democratic Party – at the head of the coalition. Nuclear energy is expected to top the agenda at the July 23 meeting in Berlin between the German chancellor and the French president.

headline: 'The passage of Trump's budget bill highlights persistent  political tensions within the American right'
description: The grip of the American president on the Republican Party's elites is more complicated than the passing of the One Big Beautiful Bill in early July might suggest, writes American political theorist Laura K. Field.

headline: Three erotic experiences inspired by… your wardrobe
description: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she explores playful games centered on the art of getting dressed – only to end up in little more than your underwear.

headline: Sexual violence scandal in French skiing was ignored for years
description: Female skiers, all of whom were underage at the time, have broken the silence surrounding the sexual harassment they suffered at the hands of Joël Chenal, an Olympic ski silver medalist who became a coach.

From Gaza to Amman, how UNRWA's family archives were rescued under fire
description: Documents attesting to the refugee status of hundreds of thousands of Palestinians were taken out of Gaza in the early months of the war and stored safely in Jordan. Le Monde tells the story of this previously unreported secret operation.

headline: How Big Tech and the American left broke up
description: 'Tech Oligarchs' (2/6). The myth of the brilliant and 'cool' inventor long concealed the true nature of Silicon Valley's leaders, who have resisted democratic efforts to regulate certain aspects of the technology sector.
byline: Damien Leloup,  Alexandre Piquard and  Raphaëlle Bacqué

headline: Conor the parrot, a somber allegory for Ukraine's trauma
description: After the death of his owner, Anton, Conor withered and appeared to lose the will to live. Tatiana, the widow, could no longer bear to hear him speak in 'the same intonations' as Anton.
